{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3429387,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-01T12:10:46.836Z","cooked":"

i am following the instructions here: allwpilib/README-CMAKE.md at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

how do I use external vendordeps (phoenix6, revlib, etc) with CMake-built wpilib? the documentation seems to only mention built-in vendordeps (romi and xrp).

on another note if someone knows, is there a way to use wpilib in another cmake project without installing? im sure theres a way but if someone can point me in the right direction thatd be great

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-10-01T12:17:12.899Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":34,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":200.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":472166,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/blob/main/README-CMAKE.md#using-vendordeps","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"allwpilib/README-CMAKE.md at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib/472166/1","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3429394,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-01T12:32:17.329Z","cooked":"

Vendordeps are completely DIY with cmake. You’ll need to look at the json, download the appropriate maven artifacts, extract them, and point your cmake build to those headers/libraries.

At least in its current form, the cmake build is not intended for building robot programs. Its purpose is primarily to support coprocessors for which we don’t build pre-built binaries, but want to have ntcore or cscore libraries available.

Regarding using the cmake build without installing it, it should be possible to use cmake ExternalProject.

okay, makes sense. one thing I could not figure out was finding the maven artifacts. i was able to get to the maven-metadata.xml file for a given group and artifact id, but not how gradlerio converts the data given in the json file into a maven url for an actual file.

(ive figured out now that revlib distributes files on github too, and ctre is moot because they require apt)

nevadexehs:

ctre is moot because they require apt

One thing to note is that our apt distribution is our non-FRC (non-WPI) distribution.
If you want classes that implement WPILib classes you’ll need to grab them from our maven, which the MavenFetcher class should cover.
If all you want is generic Phoenix6 and don’t care about the WPILib integration, then apt along with find_package(phoenix6) should be fine.

Yep, the requirements between using the FRC and non-FRC variants of our libraries are essentially identical (everything plus WPILib). You can reference the non-FRC requirements here, but it boils down to socketCAN for Linux and CANivore for Windows.

Phoenix 6

Requirements

This document explains the requirements to use Phoenix 6. Supported Devices: Phoenix 6 supports the following devices: TalonFX ( Falcon 500, Kraken X60), CANcoder, Pigeon 2.0. CAN Bus Requirements:...

i have successfully linked the libraries and am able to reference certain things. however, once i tried to use a CANSparkMax, which involves more of the library, i am getting a lot of issues regarding WPI_DEPRECATED("something"). what do i have to do to solve this? ive tried linking wpilibc and wpiutil to the library, but to no avail.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T14:25:00.218Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":45,"readers_count":44,"score":14.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":472166,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib/472166/9","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3434600,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T16:23:07.413Z","cooked":"

Those are deprecation warnings. As they are warnings, you can ignore them, but it might also be due to mismatched versions, where we deprecated something they used previously. As soon as you introduce vendor dependencies, versioning also becomes critical to avoid ABI incompatibilities that can cause runtime crashes. What versions of the CANSparkMax library and WPILib are you trying to use? If you’re using the HEAD of WPILib, an updated version of the CANSparkMax library hasn’t been released yet to match it, as we’re just about to enter the beta testing period.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T16:23:58.626Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":34,"readers_count":33,"score":11.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472166,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57670,"username":"nevadexehs","name":"neev dadhania","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib/472166/10","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3434638,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T17:39:07.444Z","cooked":"

i am using revlib 2024.2.4, and wpilib HEAD. i will try the last wpilib release for 2024, if that still doesnt work ill make a regex to remove all instances of WPI_DEPRECATED() from the rev headers. for clarity, heres some of the errors i was getting. it seems like the compiler just isnt understanding the WPI_DEPRECATED macro, so if theres something i have to do for that lmk.

errors

image2198×672 146 KB

/home/team204/thirdparty/revlib/include/rev/CANSparkBase.h:373:9: error: expected unqualified-id before string constant 373 | "Use " | ^~~~~~ /home/team204/thirdparty/revlib/include/rev/CANSparkBase.h:372:20: error: expected ‘)’ before string constant 372 | WPI_DEPRECATED( | ~^ | ) 373 | "Use " | ~~~~~~ In file included from /home/team204/thirdparty/revlib/include/rev/CANSparkMax.h:32, from /home/team204/ros2_ws/src/mypkg/src/motor.cpp:2: /home/team204/thirdparty/revlib/include/rev/SparkMaxAlternateEncoder.h:70:12: error: ‘double rev::SparkMaxAlternateEncoder::GetPosition() const’ marked ‘override’, but does not override 70 | double GetPosition() const override; | ^~~~~~~~~~~ /home/team204/thirdparty/revlib/include/rev/SparkMaxAlternateEncoder.h:80:12: error: ‘double rev::SparkMaxAlternateEncoder::GetVelocity() const’ marked ‘override’, but does not override 80 | double GetVelocity() const override; | ^~~~~~~~~~~

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T17:39:07.444Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":31,"readers_count":30,"score":11.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":472166,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-external-vendordeps-with-cmake-wpilib/472166/11","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3434644,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T17:42:33.493Z","cooked":"

It looks like it’s missing an include (e.g. it was relying on an include that was previously, but no longer, transitively included by one of the WPILib headers it included). The mismatched versions is the reason for this. Either use 2024 for both, or wait for the upcoming 2025 beta releases of both WPILib and the vendor libraries.

yep. found the culprit:

image2338×1332 288 KB

commit came in less than a week after last 2024 release, unlucky me!

while i could just add those lines back, ill have to recompile anyways so im going to use the 2024.3.2 release of wpilib for now im going to add the lines back so i can use the same build process, thanks for the help!

guess who learned it the hard way

i guess its all a part of the journey, sometimes i forget that some people on CD are actual professionals.

rev library was spitting out errors about fmt for some reason, but after i deleted 2025 wpilib headers and libs from /usr/local/ and then built and installed wpilib 2024.3.2, and it worked like a charm.
